website_summaries.verdict: This sander combines quality and a wide range of top features, all at a very attractive price.
pros: Solid construction and smoother oscillating action
Light enough to easily move around
Good power at a great price
cons: Machine runs very loudly, so plan on also purchasing earplugs
No storage area for the extra washers that are used with the spindles

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this from Amazon for a great price. Works as good as one twice the price. Did not receive instructions in the box but WEN customer service promptly emailed me a complete set. Machine itself is reasonably quiet, well built and does what it is suppose to do. If your woodworking requires inside curves, you'll wonder how you ever did without one. After buying the supposed "best" tools for the most money, I'm finding that WEN power tools do just as good a job for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: skyshot

customer_reviews.title: Good unit over all
customer_reviews.text: This spindle sander is a great entry level option. Not as nice as the ones that convert into oscillating belt Sanders as well, but it doesn't claim to be. The tool is a must have if you frequently cut with a bandsaw since it leaves such rough edges. This has been a great addition to my shop. I still working out the best protection for the top, it rusts if you ever think about water within 10 feet of it. Pros Many spindle diameter choices Good strength Solid top Cons Top rusts incredible easily Easy to over tighten spindle nut
customer_reviews.author: ZD

customer_reviews.title: Get it already
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome addition to my garage. It will greatly speed up the knife and self bow projects I am working on. Good power so it doesn't bog down.
customer_reviews.author: anthony miller

customer_reviews.title: Cuts sanding time down to 1/4 the time of hand sanding.
customer_reviews.text: I do lots of intarsia, this thing cuts down my sanding time. The 1st one burned up in a few weeks and I returned it. It was replaced in an amazingly short time, probably before Amazon received the return! I just wish that I could find replacement sanding drums in higher grits. UPDATE: It is now 9/14/2019 I am working on family gifts for Christmas 2019, and the sander has once again burned up. I am only sanding 1/2" wood, nothing hard like oak, and nothing but sanding down sharp edges. The warranty has run out, and I will be replacing it with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: le avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Typical import quality
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad sander...a bit loud and makes a strange noise when winding down after shutting it off, sounds like the moving parts are in a bit of a bind or something. The plastic body seems very light and not very robust, but the cast table top seems to be fairly durable. This unit appears to be the same as many other sanders only with different color and brand stamped on them. Everything is chinese import now and unless one retailer is specifying heavier bearings or something for their units, then these are all the same and Wen has the best price, so yeah, might as well go with them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Cone

customer_reviews.title: Works how it should
customer_reviews.text: Haven't heard a lot about WEN products, but so far I am not disappointed. There is definitely nothing fancy about this sander, but every time I turn it on it works and guess what? It sands. That's all I can ask at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but two of the rubber drums don't fit in their storage location in the base.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool overall, but dissapointed in one flaw. The two smallest rubber drums do not fit in their allotted space on the base. The outside diameter of the drums rub against the base. If you ever get them on, they wouldn't come off easily. Also, I think there should be a hook or something to store the extra spindle washers that are not being used. I like the storage for the throat plates and wrench. I have a small shop, so keeping everything together is important to me. Functionally, it is a great sander and other than the roller storage, I am quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I wish I had bought one years ago....
customer_reviews.text: After 30 years of telling myself that I didn't need an oscillating spindle sander I bought this for a job building night stands with multiple curves to be sanded and finished It worked great for that job and saved me hours of hand work. Since then, I find I frequently go to the spindle sander. Changing diameters is quick and easy. The sander is heavy enough so that I have not had to bolt it down, although it would be easy to do so. Dust collection is good, noise is low.
customer_reviews.author: jas. wilkinsTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I have four WEN products now (Band saw, air filtration unit, belt sander and this spindle sander). I am a believer. My WEN products stand up well to almost daily use and the build quality is good. There is plastic here and there but also solid metal where needed. This spindle sander has a heavy metal table and good quality construction throughout. In particular, there is storage for every single component. I highly recommend it and also recommend buying more sanding paper in 120 and 220 grit.
customer_reviews.author: AcidGambit

customer_reviews.title: warranty
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the unit yet because when I assembled it and read the instructions it says warranty is VOID if you don't have a dust collection system hooked up. Have to do that before I can use it. This information should have been with all the other specks when a person is reviewing for purchase. They should let you know that on the front end.
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: [ Review for the oscillating spindle sander only. NOT for the belt & spindle sander. (Amazon, please stop combining reviews like this.) ] I'm delighted with this machine. It's solidly built, and most importantly it doesn't wobble! My only complaint is that the dust port is slightly bigger than the hose on my shop vac. (But the way these things usually go I'd actually be surprised if it did fit.)
customer_reviews.author: M Krebs

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good things to say.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, pretty happy with this. Table top isn't perfectly flat, the front is pretty close, but not exactly 90 degrees to the spindle. Rear portion of the table is better. Table top was very rough, I used my orbital sander to smooth it down and then applied Minwax paste wax. I really like the fact that it has a port to attach my Wet Dri Vac, although I did need an adapter. I'm just a hobbyist so this will work for most of my projects. With just a bit more attention to detail, this could be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great little spindle sander
customer_reviews.text: I am a retired patternmaker (woodworker) who used industrial spindle sanders for over 40 years. I was surprised and delighted with the quality of this table top sander. It is heavy enough that it doesn't need to be fastened down, but light enough that I can move it by myself. I just used it to sand some 6" holes in some hardwood plywood and it made quick and accurate work of it. I also have a WEN drill press that I really like. The quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Utonian

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my first Spindle Sander
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with all the sanding involved in building a wooden geared clock. It has worked perfectly for hours and hours. I'm more sensitive to noise that most people, but I simply use the same ear plugs I take to concerts and wear on airplanes and I hear well enough after an hour of sanding to go back to the studio and edit music again. The sander seems very solid. Everything fits and works very well. I also picked up a 18 piece assorted set of sanding sleeves in 80, 120 and 240 grit. They exactly fit the rubber drums that came with the WEN.
customer_reviews.author: AIRecording

customer_reviews.title: All around Great Addition to my shop!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive well made shop tool! I love WEN products, and this spindle sander is my newest addition to the list. This sander is very well built, portable, yet larger than I was expecting from the photos. Its oscillating feature is a definite plus, and replacement sanding drums are easily affordable. Storage onboard the unit is very nice for all the accessories, my only disappointment would be that there should be a compartment onboard to store the washers needed for the different drums. This is a great product. Very well made, and runs quietly. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Berberich

customer_reviews.title: Have had this unit for over a year, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this unit for over a year, and under very heavy usage. To date I have been very impressed. Had the main drive belt pop off once, but anyone who has sockets, screw drivers, and a head on their shoulders can pop it back on in 5 minutes or less.
customer_reviews.author: AkGrayWolf

customer_reviews.title: No opinion yet but hopeful!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this a mid range score because I haven’t taken it out of the box yet and thus no clue as to whether it’s great or junk. I’m building a new shop so not ready for it yet. I looked at every possible maker of these sanders and decided on this one because if the spindle sizes, table shape, power and price. I have lots of sanders and do lots of crafts projects. If I chose well, I’ll be a happy camper. Check back in about 5 months and I’ll let ya know how satisfied I am
customer_reviews.author: DES

customer_reviews.title: Does what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: The WEN 6510T 3.5 Amp Oscillating Spindle Sander is a good value for the money. It is compact and fits nicely on my bench. Changing the spindles is easy. It is quiet for a sander. Much quieter than my belt/disc sander. It does a good job of removing material. Wish I had bought it a long time ago. Would have save many hours of hand sanding contours.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Spindle not square to table; table wavy...
customer_reviews.text: ...so it's going back to Amazon. Spindle was 1/16" out of square in 3". Table sloped at left and right edges, as well as having a dip in the center. Just amazing that such basic aspects are eluding quality control. We're going to try the Triton next, from Rockler.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Dustrude

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The rotation speed is slow and it dose ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The rotation speed is slow and it dose not take a long stroke but it preforms good. The sanding drums are easy to change and the different drum sizes make it easy to sand different curves. The working surface is cast and polished making it easy to slide material along the drum. The base is composite seems durable, The vacuum port is located in the back which for my shop isn't convenient because it requires more space. Overall the machine is good comparable to much more expensive machines.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Had a year and it still going. Fisherman308
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year. Works great except dust collection but that is typical of most spindle sanders. I have had three wen products and the only one I didn’t like was the Scroll Saw. Nice wen has a two year warranty as well. I never had to use it. I am ussally a dewalt tool man but this sander fits the bill and saves the wallet. Check out my full review on YouTube at fisherman308. I also show my homemade tool stand for this too. Fisherman308
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for first time I put any pressure on it the Spindle has Broken didn't even use it for 30 minutes. It is headed for the garbage can
customer_reviews.author: MrCaravayo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed my new spindle sander, and I am NOT disappointed! No assembly (other than what you will do each time you use it). All parts are there. Machine has nice storage for them on posts around the perimeter of its base. Works flawlessly. Little to no vibration. Sound? It is NOT nearly as loud as my radial saw; not unpleasant at all. For the price, I am more than happy and look forward to many hours of use!
customer_reviews.author: Mousehouse1950

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted a spindle sander. I had a specific need when trying to reproduce a wood spoke wheel for a 1920 auto. I needed to sand spokes prior to using a 1/2” round over in my router. Worked beyond expectation. He any duty and easy to use. I hooked it to my dust collector and very little dust escaped. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sander for a crafts person, creator & more
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty sizes of sanding sleeves, for several different size area's hard to sand or create. This sander is made solid, and it doesn't bounce around, but I do suggest securing it to a table, or bench before use. The sleeve's are easy to change, and it;s quite quiet, for a oscillating, 1/2 hp, machine. I am impressed with this sander, and WEN. Over 30 years ago, I purchased a WEN hand Scroll jig saw, and I still use it. In 30 year's, no issues! Thank's WEN
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: WEN products are worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this sander now for several months and it works great. The dust collection system port connects to my shop vac 2.5" connector hose and I virtually don't have any dust problems. I purchased an extra set of belts but have not had to change any out as of yet. If you only have used a spindle sander on your drill press you will quickly see why an oscillating sander brings it to a whole new level. I did a lot of comparison shopping of spindle sanders before I bought this one and I can say that I am impressed with all the WEN products I have purchased. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TL RVer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and it shows
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box one of the rubber drums wobbled. They did replace it and now the spindle itself is wobbling. I have 2 other spindle sanders a delta and a craftsman and never a problem for years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike f.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Dollar
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the dollar. I have around 30 hours running it and it's better than I expected. The motor seems solid and doesn't bog leaning into it. I don't have the right sized dust connector so it's basically covered in dust and with no bad effects. A few people mentioned something about storage for extra washers. That's true but I just stuck a small dowel in one of bolt down holes for the extra washers. I also got a Wen table top belt sander 6 - 7 months before this and use it heavily. It's also hanging in there just fine with a hundred or two hours on it. For the money, it's really tough to beat these tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sander, as good or better than those that are much more expensive.
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing average or below about this sander. It's a go-to tool in my woodshop. Great value, and the quality can't be beat even at much higher prices. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PghDrake

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had my sander for two days now, and ive used it quite a bit. So far it seems to be working well. Its not very loud at all, sands well. Im using it to contour sand guitar bodies that are 2" thick solid mahogany which is a very hard wood. Its handling the job with no issues. the motor isnt bogging down or making any weird noises. it has onboard storage for all of the accessories which is nice. so far i would definitely recommend this sander. Ill update my review if i have any issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: Wen products are quality and fairly priced. This sander is no exception! It’s easy to set up and it runs very smooth. There was a strange smell when I used it the first couple of times but I think it was just due to the fact that it was brand new as it had gone away. The only complaint I have is that the plates that sit on the table below the sander aren’t perfectly level with the rest of the surface so it can cause a piece you are sanding to catch but just be aware of that and it won’t cause you any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed`
customer_reviews.text: This was a tool that I was unsure how much I would use. Very useful and even though it was not mentioned in a tool review of similar units in a woodworking magazine I feel it is an excellent value and probably just as good as those rated and certainly cheeper.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Just as good if not better than high dollar spindle sanders!!!
customer_reviews.text: I watched this on Amazon for over a year and finally purchased it when the price went down to $88. If I would of known how awesome it was I would of bought sooner. Definitely very happy with how it works!!! All the reviews that say it's too loud or the table isn't smooth are crazy. I've been wood working for 20+yrs, I have several sanding machines and this is by far best sander for the price. Its very sturdy and well made. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O

customer_reviews.title: Oscillating Spindle Sander
customer_reviews.text: For light to moderate use this Oscillating Spindle Sander is good quality, easy to use, adapted to my existing vacuum system and made a number of different projects very easy to shape and finish. WEN packaging protected the unit from the rigors of shipping with a heavy duty container. Seller shipped the sander promptly and the unit arrived as advertised. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray F. Longaker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by the price and quality. Did not think it would be this nice, work so smooth and sand as nice as it does. Everything is top quality and the minute I unboxed it ran it for about 4 hours on aluminum. Everything stores nicely on the machine, and has enough weight to it that can be set up on a welding table without bolting down and does not move. I took a chance on this sander and definatly was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great sander! Had to find a way to adapt my 10 gallon wet vac to it, & you won’t believe what I came up with! I used a polyurethane collapsing sleeve that covers an umbrella! I cut off the excess pieces, and the fit is just PERFECT! Actually my wife suggested the umbrella sleeve. I just had to do the rest! I couldn’t have purchased one that works this well!
customer_reviews.author: The sword king

customer_reviews.title: good sander but throat plate inserts suck
customer_reviews.text: awesome sander powerful lots of attachments easy to use only one thing the throat insert playes are a little off not level with the platform this can result in stuff getting caught they need to improve that but other than this its a great sander
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sander, missing some parts
customer_reviews.text: Product works well, however it was missing the smallest sanding drum. (came with sandpaper for it but no drum) With vacuum connected to it very little dust. I have several Wen tools and for the price you can't beat them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint; fantastic tool
customer_reviews.text: It arrived exactly as depicted. It is fairly heavy and very stable during use. I can't believe I waited so long to buy this. I had a bunch of contours I had cut out for a porch swing and this tool helped me get the pieces sized and smoothed very quick. Not a problem, but the nut wrench that came with it was sized differently than the nut on the spindle; not sure which was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first spindle sander that I have ever owned. I own other WEN bench tools, and I like their quality, which is the reason I bought this. It works like a dream! It is so easy to change out the different size drums, and it makes sanding a breeze, especially on inside curves. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun, seems pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Never seen one before - seems really clever. Using for kydex sheath making and it's awesome. Allows user to hold work piece with two hands for greater control. Can change round thing sizes depending on how tight of curves you are grinding. It's big and pretty stable. I put a cut up moving box around the back of it to help contain the dust. Didn't have any luck attaching a vacuum to it. It's fairly loud. If I was using for long stretches I'd consider using ear plugs for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: contactbarker

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tool
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sander, the main reasons is the revolution speed , metal body and table and the over all performance. The last one I owned cost at least twice the price ( different brand) of this one and was not made as good as this sander . If I had to but another one, I would buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Product as described. Received item as promised.
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described and works awesome. The fit and finish are more than acceptable for this kind of tool. I have used this many times while making some adirondack chairs. I had to use a band saw to make some of the curved cuts, and this sander took care of those areas with ease. The consumables last a long time. But if you need to purchase them, the price is more than reasonable. Thanks for making a great tool. Also, the price is $10 cheaper now than when I purchased it a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Al_Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but the sanding sleeve is too big for the drum or vice versa. The way I fixed it was to add a couple of bigger washers on top. When you tighten the nut it compresses the drum and tightens the sleeve. Doesn't work as good as my last one but it was cheaper and I didn't have to run into town to get it
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: Poorly make, malfunctioned with very little use. Buy Rigid instead, cost more but performs great!
customer_reviews.author: Fair review

customer_reviews.title: Good sander
customer_reviews.text: Held up to the UPS kickball game to my front door (sander, not packaging). Spindle was only off by a miniscule amount, not a full degree. Nothing I'm worried about, but shims would easily fix. Normal noise. Sanding spools stay put, no walking. Drilled two holes in plastic and added a peg hook to hold washers.
customer_reviews.author: TikiShoppe

customer_reviews.title: Will do the job.
customer_reviews.text: It works, and it works well. Clone sander, same as 4 other brands on Amazon and at Harbor Freight. All made the same, with different colors for different manufacturers. The relatively low max sanding depth limits it's applications on some jobs, but it's cheap and it works.
customer_reviews.author: christopherTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and I liked how easy it was to put together and start using. I read complaints about the volume, but this does not seem to be excessively loud like a few of the reviews claimed, especially if you’re wearing the appetite hearing protection. I would recommend this to someone looking for a decent tool for a reasonable price. It gets the job done for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Szente

customer_reviews.title: Solid design
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit bulky, but it adds stability for sanding larger pieces. I can't really think of any issues I've had with it. Also, it seems a LOT of YouTube woodworkers have this exact one.
customer_reviews.author: Photostefanie

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Good power, doesn’t bog down. Noise level not an issue, shop vac makes same amount. Dust collection with vac is excellent. Much better than HF machine and cheaper. Bought grinder stand at HF for $23 (20% coupon). Built platform to attach to stand as shown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the hobbyist.
customer_reviews.text: Compare to the (insert name brand here) and you'll find that this is the same machine with different colors. Same motor, same top, same everything for a lot less money. Buy this, save some coin to spend on other toys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews, but I was skeptical since it was half the price of some other brands. I am pleasantly surprised. The instructions are slightly lacking (no mention of the split washer), but the item seems put together well and the table is very nice. Not terribly heavy, but seems stable and very usable. One thing to mention; it smells cheap. Out of the box, the smell is surprisingly reminiscent of walking into Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: bernie the gooner

customer_reviews.title: good saner
customer_reviews.text: At this price I dont know how this sander can be beat. It does just was it was built to do and seems like if will last a good long time. At this point I have had it for a couple years and have gotten good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have been uniformally happy with WEN products. Very inexpensive, but work well. I am a casual hobbyist so I don't consider this to be an industrial class machine but they cost ten times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stubbie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great sander, 1/2 HP motor will let you apply plenty of pressure without bogging down motor. I have ordered 2 additional Wen products, very happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Sanding Cylinders Wear Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The sanding cylinders that come with the sander are not very durable. They wear out really quickly. he sander itself is great, but a higher quality sanding cylinder is badly needed.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wright

customer_reviews.title: Value and function
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. I really suggest getting one of those abrasive belt cleaning sticks and keeping your sanding disck clean. Save you some money that way.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased several items from Wen and I have to say they are great tools for the money. I’m in my woodshop all day everyday and this sander is worth its weight in gold. If you’re looking for a workhorse for small pieces this is it. Heck I even used it to sand some corbels for a custom arbor, 2x12x10, and it worked great. I won’t do that again for obvious reasons but it pulled through in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance buying this. Never bought any Wen products before. Works great and doesn't bog down. Can't beat the price for what you get. Compared it to the Harbor Freight $139 model and the Wen has a stronger motor and more Oscillations.
customer_reviews.author: Iskuse

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I never knew how much I needed one of these until I got one. Got by for years with a drum sander kit on my drill press. Oscillating movement makes a huge difference in speed and smoothness. Heavy cast top makes for a solid tool.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Nice oscillating sander
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and went with this unit. So far so good. It does what it’s supposed to do. It isn’t overly loud, which is nice. Typical Amazon order; product was as described and no problems with the order.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Good sander
customer_reviews.text: So far the sander works as expected. It's one of the easiest shop tools to use. The only thing I dinged the transaction on is the box. If I was at home when it was delivered, I may have returned it just on how the box looked. It looked like it was torn open and reaped. I think it was a return. I put it together and made sure all the parts were there. Overall, I would tell someone to buy the sander and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Husband is Thrilled With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for his tool shop. He shopped for this type of sander and decided Winn made a good one. It arrived a day early, packaged well, and is already set up and being used. He is thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power and great dust collection
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described, not as loud as I would have thought. Made fast work out of smoothing out large oval openings in 3/4 plywood, plenty of power. Dust collection was excellent using a shop vac and a 1 1/2” adapter. Virtually no sawdust escapes as long as you use the included rings around the sanding drums. Uses standard spindle sanding drums that are widely available. Arrived very well packed.
customer_reviews.author: S. J.

customer_reviews.title: Been eyeing this for a while!
customer_reviews.text: It may not be a must have item for your shop, but surely one of the first ones to add after the must haves. This sander comes from a good company, well built and does the job you would expect. Easy to put together and the instruction manual is clear and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Morris

customer_reviews.title: Working great, cast iron table stable.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price point. The cast iron table was heavy enough to keep from dancing around. Sanding spindles are tight and don't slip. I would buy this again if I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: and I love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional woodworker, and I love this tool. Received it today, set it up, and I got everything sanded over a 3 hour period. Easy change out of spindles, just a nice affordable unit
customer_reviews.author: Tap Duncan

customer_reviews.title: It works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Since I've never owned a WEN product I was skeptical of the lower price , but decided to take a chance. It works like a champ !! customer_reviews.title: and it did a fine job. I hooked up my dust collector to ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. I bought it to sand the band-sawn curves on a set of 38 gable brackets I was making for the gables on my house, and it did a fine job. I hooked up my dust collector to the unit, and it seemed to capture most (95% ?) of the dust from the cedar I was using for the brackets. I only used the large drum so far, so can't comment on the smaller ones. For the price, it worked out fine. It appears to be the same unit that I saw at Harbor Freight and a couple of other places, and this one had the best price.

product_meta.title: WEN AT6535 3.5-Amp Oscillating Spindle Sander with Extra Large Beveling Table Top
product_meta.description: Style:Beveling TableRemember when you had to sand those pieces by hand? Take on arcs, curves, contours, faces and more with the WEN Oscillating Spindle Sander. This versatile machine includes five different sized sanding spindles (1/2 inch, 3/4 inch, 1 inch, 1-1/2 inch and 2 inch), each one oscillating up to 58 times per minute with a 5/8-inch stroke. The powerful 3.5 amp motor rotates the various spindles 2000 times per minute. Onboard storage helps to organize all of the throat plates, rubber sanding drums and table inserts included with this sander while the 1-1/2 inch dust port allows woodworkers to connect a dust collection system to minimize clean up. Adjust the spacious 14.5 by 14.5-inch table anywhere from 0 to 45 degrees to help take on angled edges and surfaces. This sander also comes with five 80 grit sanding sleeves. And because its a WEN Product, your tool comes backed by a two year warranty, a nationwide network of skilled service technicians and a friendly customer help line. It’s time to shake things up with the WEN Oscillating Spindle Sander. Remember when you could easily sand any curve or edge your heart desired? Remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Features five sizes of sanding sleeves: 1/2 inch, 3/4 inch, 1 inch, 1-1/2 inch, and 2 inches
2000 RPM motor oscillates spindle 58 times per minute with a 5/8-inch stroke
Onboard storage maintains organization of all accessories and sandpapers
Spacious 14-1/2 by 14-1/2-inch table bevels up to 45 degrees to accommodate angled workpieces
Includes a beveling work table, a dust port, ten throat plates, five 80-grit sanding sleeves, four rubber sanding drums, and a two-year warranty
